00002 //
00003 // = LIBRARY
00004 //    ulib - c++ library
00005 //
00006 // = FILENAME
00007 //    event.h - wrapper for libevent (A library to execute a function when a
00008 //                                                                                                specific event occurs on a file descriptor)

00015 #ifndef ULIB_EVENT_H

00018 #include <ulib/timeval.h>

00020 #include <event.h>
00021 
00022 /*
00023  * libevent is a popular API that provides a mechanism to execute a callback
00024  * function when a specific event occurs on a file descriptor or after a
00025  * timeout has been reached. Furthermore, libevent also support callbacks due
00026  * to signals or regular timeouts.
00027  */
00028 
00035 class U_EXPORT UEvent_Base : public event
00036 {
00037 public:
00038 
00039         // NB: l'oggetto puo' essere usato come (struct event) in quanto UMemoryError viene allocato dopo...
00040         U_MEMORY_TEST
00041 
00042         // Allocator e Deallocator
00043         U_MEMORY_ALLOCATOR
00044         U_MEMORY_DEALLOCATOR
00045 
00052         int fd() { return EVENT_FD(this); }
00053 
00063         bool pending(short ev = EV_READ, UTimeVal* tv = 0)
00064                 {
00065                 U_TRACE(1, "UEvent_Base::pending(%hd,%p)", ev, tv)
00066 
00067                 if (U_SYSCALL(event_pending, "%p,%hd,%p", this, ev, tv)) U_RETURN(true);
00068 
00069                 U_RETURN(false);
00070                 }
00071 
00078         bool timeout(UTimeVal& tv) { return pending(EV_TIMEOUT, &tv); }
00079 
00090         bool priority(int priority)
00091                 {
00092                 U_TRACE(1, "UEvent_Base::priority(%d)", priority)
00093 
00094                 U_INTERNAL_ASSERT_MSG((ev_flags & EVLIST_ACTIVE) != 0, "can't change the priority of an active event")
00095 
00096                 if (U_SYSCALL(event_priority_set, "%p,%d", this, priority)) U_RETURN(false);
00097 
00098                 U_RETURN(true);
00099                 }
00100 
00101 #ifdef DEBUG
00102         const char* dump(bool reset) const;
00103 #endif
00104 
00105 protected:
00106         UEvent_Base()                                                                            {} // NB: This is an concept class, you can't instantiate it.
00107 
00108 private:
00109         UEvent_Base(const UEvent_Base&)                          {}
00110         UEvent_Base& operator=(const UEvent_Base&) { return *this; }
00111 };
00112 
00128 typedef void (*ccallback_type)(int, short, void*); // C function used as callback in the C API
00129 
00130 template <typename F> class U_EXPORT UEvent : public UEvent_Base
00131 {
00132 public:
00133 
00142         UEvent(int fd, short ev, F& handler)
00143                 {
00144                 U_TRACE_REGISTER_OBJECT(0, UEvent<F>, "%d,%hd,%p", fd, ev, &handler)
00145 
00146                 U_SYSCALL_VOID(event_set, "%p,%d,%hd,%p,%p", this, fd, ev, wrapper, (void*)&handler);
00147                 }
00148 
00149         ~UEvent()
00150                 {
00151                 U_TRACE_UNREGISTER_OBJECT(0, UEvent)
00152                 }
00153 
00154 #ifdef DEBUG
00155         const char* dump(bool reset) const { return UEvent_Base::dump(reset); }
00156 #endif
00157 
00158         static void wrapper(int fd, short ev, void* h)
00159                 {
00160                 U_TRACE(0, "UEvent::wrapper(%d,%hd,%p)", fd, ev, h)
00161 
00162                 F& handler = *(F*)h;
00163 
00164                 handler(fd, ev);
00165                 }
00166 
00167 protected:
00168         UEvent() {}
00169 
00170 private:
00171         UEvent<F>(const UEvent<F>&)            {}
00172         UEvent<F>& operator=(const UEvent<F>&) { return *this; }
00173 };
00174

00197

00208 #endif

00216 };

00233 template <typename F> class U_EXPORT UTimerEv : public UEvent<F>
00234 {
00241         UTimerEv(F& handler)
00242                 {
00243                 U_TRACE_REGISTER_OBJECT(0, UTimerEv, "%p", &handler)
00244 
00245                 U_SYSCALL_VOID(event_set, "%p,%d,%hd,%p,%p", this, -1, 0, UEvent<F>::wrapper, (void*)&handler);
00246                 }
00247 
00248         ~UTimerEv()
00249                 {
00250                 U_TRACE_UNREGISTER_OBJECT(0, UTimerEv)
00251                 }
00252 
00253 #ifdef DEBUG
00254         const char* dump(bool reset) const { return UEvent_Base::dump(reset); }
00255 #endif
00256 
00257 protected:
00258         UTimerEv() {}
00259 
00260 private:

00262         UTimerEv& operator=(const UTimerEv&) { return *this; }
00263 };

00324 template <typename F> class U_EXPORT USignal : public UEvent<F>
00325 {
00326 public:
00327 
00335         USignal(int signum, F& handler)
00336                 {
00337                 U_TRACE_REGISTER_OBJECT(0, USignal, "%d,%p", signum, &handler)
00338 
00339                 U_SYSCALL_VOID(event_set, "%p,%d,%hd,%p,%p", this, signum, EV_SIGNAL | EV_PERSIST, UEvent<F>::wrapper, (void*)&handler);
00340                 }
00341 
00342         ~USignal()
00343                 {
00344                 U_TRACE_UNREGISTER_OBJECT(0, USignal)
00345                 }
00346

00354

00357 #endif

00420 typedef UEvent<ccallback_type>   cevent;        // Shortcut to C-style event.
00421 typedef USignal<ccallback_type>  csignal;       // Shortcut to C-style signal handler.
00422 typedef UTimerEv<ccallback_type> ctimer;  // Shortcut to C-style timer.

00433 template <typename O, typename M> class U_EXPORT UMemCb
00434 {
00435 public:
00436 
00450         UMemCb(O& object, M method) : _object(object), _method(method) {}
00451 
00452         void operator()(int fd, short ev) { (_object.*_method)(fd, ev); }
00453 
00454 protected:
00455         O& _object;
00456         M  _method;

00473 class U_EXPORT UDispatcher
00474 {
00475 public:
00476 
00477         // Miscellaneous constants
00478 
00479         enum {
00480                 DEFAULT_PRIORITY = -1,                                  // Default priority (the middle value).
00481                 ONCE                              = EVLOOP_ONCE,     // Loop just once.
00482                 NONBLOCK                          = EVLOOP_NONBLOCK  // Don't block the event loop.
00483         };
00484 
00491         static bool priority_init(int npriorities)
00492                 {
00493                 U_TRACE(1, "UDispatcher::priority_init(%d)", npriorities)
00494 
00495                 if (U_SYSCALL(event_base_priority_init, "%p,%d", u_ev_base, npriorities)) U_RETURN(false);
00496 
00497                 U_RETURN(true);
00498                 }
00499 
00507         static bool add(UEvent_Base& e, int priority = DEFAULT_PRIORITY)
00508                 {
00509                 U_TRACE(1, "UDispatcher::add(%p,%d)", &e, priority)
00510 
00511         //      if (U_SYSCALL(event_base_set, "%p,%p", u_ev_base, &e)) U_RETURN(false);
00512 
00513                 if (priority != DEFAULT_PRIORITY &&
00514                          U_SYSCALL(event_priority_set, "%p,%d", &e, priority))
00515                         {
00516                         U_RETURN(false);
00517                         }
00518 
00519                 if (U_SYSCALL(event_add, "%p,%p", &e, 0)) U_RETURN(false);
00520 
00521                 U_RETURN(true);
00522                 }
00523 
00535         static bool add(UEvent_Base& e, const UTimeVal& to, int priority = DEFAULT_PRIORITY)
00536                 {
00537                 U_TRACE(1, "UDispatcher::add(%p,%O,%d)", &e, U_OBJECT_TO_TRACE(to), priority)
00538 
00539         //      if (U_SYSCALL(event_base_set, "%p,%p", u_ev_base, &e)) U_RETURN(false);
00540 
00541                 if (priority != DEFAULT_PRIORITY &&
00542                          U_SYSCALL(event_priority_set, "%p,%d", &e, priority))
00543                         {
00544                         U_RETURN(false);
00545                         }
00546 
00547                 if (U_SYSCALL(event_add, "%p,%p", &e, (timeval*)&to)) U_RETURN(false);
00548 
00549                 U_RETURN(true);
00550                 }
00551 
00563         template <typename F> static bool add_once(int fd, short ev, F& handler)
00564                 {
00565                 U_TRACE(1, "UDispatcher::add_once(%d,%hd,%p)", fd, ev, &handler)
00566 
00567                 if (U_SYSCALL(event_once, "%d,%hd,%p,%p,%p", fd, ev, UDispatcher::wrapper<F>, (void*)&handler, 0)) U_RETURN(false);
00568 
00569                 U_RETURN(true);
00570                 }
00571 
00584         template <typename F> static bool add_once(int fd, short ev, F& handler, const UTimeVal& to)
00585                 {
00586                 U_TRACE(1, "UDispatcher::add_once(%d,%hd,%p,%O)", fd, ev, &handler, U_OBJECT_TO_TRACE(to))
00587 
00588                 if (U_SYSCALL(event_once, "%d,%hd,%p,%p,%p", fd, ev, UDispatcher::wrapper<F>, (void*)&handler, (timeval*)&to)) U_RETURN(false);
00589 
00590                 U_RETURN(true);
00591                 }
00592 
00605         static bool add_once(int fd, short ev, ccallback_type handler, void* arg)
00606                 {
00607                 U_TRACE(1, "UDispatcher::add_once(%d,%hd,%p,%p)", fd, ev, handler, arg)
00608 
00609                 if (U_SYSCALL(event_once, "%d,%hd,%p,%p,%p", fd, ev, handler, arg, 0)) U_RETURN(false);
00610 
00611                 U_RETURN(true);
00612                 }

00627         static bool add_once(int fd, short ev, ccallback_type handler, void* arg, const UTimeVal& to)
00628                 {
00629                 U_TRACE(1, "UDispatcher::add_once(%d,%hd,%p,%p,%O)", fd, ev, handler, arg, U_OBJECT_TO_TRACE(to))
00630 
00631                 if (U_SYSCALL(event_once, "%d,%hd,%p,%p,%p", fd, ev, handler, arg, (timeval*)&to)) U_RETURN(false);

00633                 U_RETURN(true);

00646         template <typename F> static bool add_once_timer(F& handler, const UTimeVal& to)
00647                 {
00648                 U_TRACE(1, "UDispatcher::add_once_timer(%p,%O)", &handler, U_OBJECT_TO_TRACE(to))
00649 
00650                 if (U_SYSCALL(event_once,"%d,%hd,%p,%p,%p",-1,EV_TIMEOUT,UDispatcher::wrapper<F>,(void*)&handler,(timeval*)&to)) U_RETURN(false);
00651 
00652                 U_RETURN(true);
00653                 }
00654 
00666         static bool add_once_timer(ccallback_type handler, void* arg, const UTimeVal& to)
00667                 {
00668                 U_TRACE(1, "UDispatcher::add_once_timer(%p,%p,%O)", handler, arg, U_OBJECT_TO_TRACE(to))
00669 
00670                 if (U_SYSCALL(event_once, "%d,%hd,%p,%p,%p", -1, EV_TIMEOUT, handler, arg, (timeval*)&to)) U_RETURN(false);
00671 
00672                 U_RETURN(true);
00673                 }
00674 
00683         static bool del(UEvent_Base* e)
00684                 {
00685                 U_TRACE(1, "UDispatcher::del(%p)", e)
00686 
00687                 U_INTERNAL_ASSERT_POINTER(e)
00688 
00689                 if (U_SYSCALL(event_del, "%p", e)) U_RETURN(false);
00690 
00691                 U_RETURN(true);
00692                 }
00693 
00716         static int dispatch(int flags = 0)
00717                 {
00718                 U_TRACE(1, "UDispatcher::dispatch(%d)", flags)
00719 
00720                 int ret = U_SYSCALL(event_base_loop, "%p,%d", u_ev_base, flags);
00721 
00722                 U_RETURN(ret);
00723                 }
00724 
00734         static int exit(const UTimeVal* to = 0)
00735                 {
00736                 U_TRACE(1, "UDispatcher::exit(%p)", to)
00737 
00738                 int ret = U_SYSCALL(event_base_loopexit, "%p,%p", u_ev_base, (timeval*)to);
00739 
00740                 U_RETURN(ret);
00741                 }
00742 
00743 protected:
00744         template <typename F> static void wrapper(int fd, short ev, void* h)
00745                 {
00746                 U_TRACE(0, "UDispatcher::wrapper(%d,%hd,%p)", fd, ev, h)
00747 
00748                 F& handler = *(F*)h;
00749 
00750                 handler(fd, ev);
00751                 }
00752 
00753 private:
00754         UDispatcher(const UDispatcher&)                          {}
00755         UDispatcher& operator=(const UDispatcher&) { return *this; }
00756 };
